question: A 60-year-old man is found to be unresponsive, pulseless, and apneic. You should:
answers: determine if he has a valid living will.
withhold CPR until he is defibrillated.
begin CPR until an AED is available.
start CPR and transport immediately.
correctAnswers: begin CPR until an AED is available.
selectedAnswer: begin CPR until an AED is available.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Abdominal thrusts in a conscious child or adult with a severe upper airway obstruction are performed:
answers: in sets of five followed by reassessment.
until he or she experiences cardiac arrest.
until he or she loses consciousness.
about 1 inch below the xiphoid process.
correctAnswers: until he or she loses consciousness.
selectedAnswer: until he or she loses consciousness.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: After an advanced airway device has been inserted during two-rescuer CPR, you should:
answers: pause compressions to deliver ventilations.
increase rescue breathing to a rate of 14 breaths/min.
deliver one rescue breath every 6 seconds.
decrease the compression rate to about 80 per minute.
correctAnswers: deliver one rescue breath every 6 seconds.
selectedAnswer: deliver one rescue breath every 6 seconds.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: After establishing that an adult patient is unresponsive, you should:
answers: immediately begin chest compressions.
apply the AED and deliver a shock, if needed.
manually open the airway.
assess for breathing and a pulse.
correctAnswers: assess for breathing and a pulse.
selectedAnswer: assess for breathing and a pulse.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: After ________ minutes without oxygen, permanent brain damage is possible.
answers: 2 to 3
1 to 2
4 to 6
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: A patient should be placed in the recovery position when he or she:
answers: is unresponsive, uninjured, and breathing adequately.
has experienced trauma but is breathing effectively.
is semiconscious, injured, and breathing adequately.
has a pulse but is unresponsive and breathing shallowly.
correctAnswers: is unresponsive, uninjured, and breathing adequately.
selectedAnswer: is unresponsive, uninjured, and breathing adequately.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: A team of EMTs and paramedics are attempting to resuscitate a man who is in cardiac arrest while his wife and son are present. Which of the following should occur during the resuscitation attempt?
answers: A law enforcement officer should prepare the family for the patient's death and contact the funeral home.
One EMT should update the family on the interventions that have been performed and how the patient has responded.
Each member of the resuscitation team should update the family at various intervals throughout the attempt.
Communication with the family should be minimal until the final outcome of the resuscitation attempt is known.
correctAnswers: One EMT should update the family on the interventions that have been performed and how the patient has responded.
selectedAnswer: Each member of the resuscitation team should update the family at various intervals throughout the attempt.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Complications associated with chest compressions include all of the following, EXCEPT:
answers: rib fractures.
a fractured sternum.
liver laceration.
gastric distention.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: CPR is in progress on a pregnant woman. Shortly after manually displacing her uterus to the left, return of spontaneous circulation occurs. Which of the following would MOST likely explain this?
answers: Pressure was relieved from her aorta and vena cava, which improved chest compression effectiveness.
Increased blood flow to her heart caused her ventricles to stop fibrillating, which restored her pulse.
Displacement of her uterus allowed her lungs to expand more fully, which restored her pulse.
Displacement of her uterus caused blood to flow backward, which increased blood flow to her heart.
correctAnswers: Pressure was relieved from her aorta and vena cava, which improved chest compression effectiveness.
selectedAnswer: Pressure was relieved from her aorta and vena cava, which improved chest compression effectiveness.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: CPR should be initiated when:
answers: the carotid pulse is very weak.
a valid living will is unavailable.
signs of putrefaction are present.
rigor mortis is obvious.
correctAnswers: a valid living will is unavailable.
selectedAnswer: the carotid pulse is very weak.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Gastric distention will MOST likely occur:
answers: in patients who are intubated.
when the airway is completely obstructed.
if you ventilate a patient too quickly.
when you deliver minimal tidal volume.
correctAnswers: if you ventilate a patient too quickly.
selectedAnswer: if you ventilate a patient too quickly.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: Initial treatment to dislodge a severe foreign body airway obstruction in a responsive infant involves:
answers: abdominal thrusts.
bag-mask ventilation.
blind finger sweeps.
back slaps.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: In most cases, cardiopulmonary arrest in infants and children is caused by:
answers: severe chest trauma.
a cardiac dysrhythmia.
respiratory arrest.
a drug overdose.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: In two-rescuer adult CPR, you should deliver a compression to ventilation ratio of:
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The main benefit of using a mechanical piston device for chest compressions is:
answers: the minimal training required to correctly operate the device.
its ability to be used with any patient, regardless of age, weight, or body size.
the elimination of rescuer fatigue that results from manual compressions.
the elimination of the need to place a firm, flat device under the patient.
correctAnswers: the elimination of rescuer fatigue that results from manual compressions.
selectedAnswer: the elimination of rescuer fatigue that results from manual compressions.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: The proper depth of chest compressions on a 9-month-old infant is:
answers: one half to two thirds the diameter of the chest.
one third the diameter of the chest, or about 1½ inches.
two thirds the diameter of the chest, or about 2 inches.
one half the diameter of the chest, or about 1½ inches.
correctAnswers: one third the diameter of the chest, or about 1½ inches.
selectedAnswer: one third the diameter of the chest, or about 1½ inches.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: To ensure that you will deliver the appropriate number of chest compressions during one-rescuer adult CPR, you should compress the patient's chest at a rate of:
answers: no greater than 100 compressions per minute.
80 to 100 compressions per minute.
100 to 120 compressions per minute.
at least 120 compressions per minute.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: What is the correct ratio of compressions to ventilations when performing two-rescuer child CPR?
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: What is the minimum number of chest compressions that should be delivered per minute to a 4-month-old infant?
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)

question: You and your partner arrive at the side of a 60-year-old woman who collapsed about 7 minutes ago. She is unresponsive, apneic, and pulseless. You should:
answers: apply the AED if there is no response after 10 cycles of CPR.
begin CPR at a compression to ventilation ratio of 15:2.
begin CPR and apply the AED as soon as it is available.
immediately apply the AED and analyze her cardiac rhythm.
correctAnswers: begin CPR and apply the AED as soon as it is available.
selectedAnswer: begin CPR and apply the AED as soon as it is available.
title: AHE190 04 13790 - SU25 - Emerg Medical Tech. (scope)
